intro: Psychotria balakrishnii, commonly known as the Malabar Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Western Ghats of India, where it typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
